importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication marks the announcement of Pakistan's successful launch of its first hyperspectral satellite, signaling a major development in the country's space capabilities.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The entire timeline of the event—launch, calibration, and operational deployment—falls within 2025, indicating a rapid and focused expansion of Pakistan's space program in the current year.

keyTakeAways: Pakistan has launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, marking a major milestone in its space program.
The satellite was launched from China’s Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre on October 19, 2025.
The H1 satellite is capable of detecting subtle chemical and material changes on Earth's surface, offering enhanced capabilities in agriculture, environmental monitoring, and disaster management.
SUPARCO, Pakistan’s national space agency, confirmed the successful launch and called it a pivotal step in advancing national development goals.
The satellite data is expected to improve precision agriculture, climate resilience, and natural resource management in Pakistan.
The launch reflects and strengthens Pakistan’s strategic partnership with China in peaceful space exploration and technological cooperation.
The H1 satellite will take about two months to calibrate before full operational status is achieved.
This launch is part of a broader trend in Pakistan’s space program, which has sent three satellites into orbit in 2025, including fully operational EO-1 and KS-1 satellites.
The technology supports development initiatives like the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), particularly in environmental and infrastructure planning.

namedEntities.name: Pakistan
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation in South Asia that has launched its first hyperspectral satellite, demonstrating growing technological self-reliance and strategic space ambitions.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Pakistan is the primary actor launching and benefiting from the satellite, illustrating a national commitment to technological advancement and sustainable development.

namedEntities.name: SUPARCO
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Pakistan’s national space agency responsible for the development and launch of the H1 satellite.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: SUPARCO is the key organization behind the mission, overseeing the satellite’s design, launch, and operational goals.

namedEntities.name: H1 satellite
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Pakistan’s first hyperspectral satellite, designed to detect subtle material and chemical changes on Earth’s surface.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite enables advanced applications in agriculture, disaster response, and environmental monitoring, forming the technological core of the mission.

namedEntities.name: Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A space launch facility located in northwestern China, used for the launch of Pakistan’s H1 satellite.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The launch site highlights international cooperation, as Pakistan used China’s infrastructure for its first space launch.

namedEntities.name: China
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation with which Pakistan has a strategic partnership in space exploration and development.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: China provided the launch platform, reflecting the bilateral space collaboration between Pakistan and China.

namedEntities.name: China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major infrastructure initiative linking China’s Xinjiang to Pakistan’s Gwadar Port.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The hyperspectral satellite data will support environmental and geohazard monitoring critical to the long-term success of CPEC development.

namedEntities.name: Precision agriculture
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A farming method that uses technology to optimize crop yields and resource use.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite enables better crop quality monitoring, enhancing agricultural productivity in Pakistan.

namedEntities.name: Environmental monitoring
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The ongoing tracking of natural conditions and changes in ecosystems.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The satellite supports real-time environmental assessment, particularly for water resources and climate change adaptation.

namedEntities.name: Disaster management
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The ability to detect and respond to natural disasters like floods or landslides.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hyperspectral data can identify early signs of geohazards, improving early warning systems in Pakistan.

namedEntities.name: EO-1 and KS-1 satellites
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Two other fully operational satellites launched by Pakistan in 2025.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They provide context for the significance of H1 as Pakistan’s first hyperspectral mission in a growing national space program.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Pakistan has successfully launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, from China’s Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre on October 19, 2025. The satellite, developed by the national space agency SUPARCO, is designed to detect subtle chemical and material changes on Earth, enabling advanced applications in precision agriculture, environmental monitoring, disaster risk assessment, and urban planning. This milestone reflects Pakistan’s growing self-reliance in space technology and strengthens its strategic partnership with China, particularly in supporting infrastructure projects like the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC). While full operational status is expected within two months, the launch marks a pivotal step in Pakistan’s broader space program, which has seen three satellite launches in 2025, including two already in orbit. The data from H1 is expected to significantly improve national capacity for sustainable development and climate resilience.
title: Pakistan launches its first hyperspectral satellite
